tool.name: @BINARY@
tool.description: clusters single-cell Hi-C interaction matrices with MinHash dimension reduction
tool.command:
@BINARY@
--matrix '$matrix_mcooler'
--numberOfClusters $numberOfClusters
--clusterMethod $clusterMethod_selector --numberOfHashFunctions $numberOfHashFunctions #if $chromosomes: #set $chromosome = ' '.join([ '\'%s\'' % $chrom for $chrom in str($chromosomes).split(' ') ]) --chromosomes $chromosome #end if
#if $exactModeMinhash: $exactModeMinhash #end if
--outFileName cluster_list.txt
--threads @THREADS@

param.name: numberOfClusters
param.label: Number of clusters
param.help: How many clusters should be computed by kmeans or spectral clustering

param.name: numberOfHashFunctions
param.label: Number of hash functions
param.help: How many hash functions the minHash algorithm uses.

param.name: chromosomes
param.label: List of chromosomes to consider
param.help: Please separate the chromosomes by space

param.name: exactModeMinhash
param.label: The MinHash algorithm computes additional the exact euclidean distance.

tool.help:
Clustering with dimension reduction via MinHash ===============================================
scHicClusterMinHash uses kmeans or spectral clustering to associate each cell to a cluster and therefore to its cell cycle. The clustering is applied on dimension reduced data based on an approximate kNN search with the local sensitive hashing technique MinHash. This approach reduces the number of dimensions from samples * (number of bins)^2 to samples * samples. Please consider also the other clustering and dimension reduction approaches of the scHicExplorer suite. They can give you better results, can be faster or less memory demanding.
For more information about scHiCExplorer please consider our documentation on readthedocs.io_
.. _readthedocs.io: http://schicexplorer.readthedocs.io/
